newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Sulzer sells foundry to management.
newsitem.headline: Sulzer sells foundry to management.

text.p: Sulzer AG said it had sold a Swiss foundry to management in a continuing program of focusing on five main technology divisions.
A Sulzer statement said foundry subsidiary Sulzer Buelachguss expected 1996 sales of over 30 million Swiss francs and had a workforce of 165 people.
It said the management buy-out would secure future operations at the Buelach foundry and no job cuts were involved in the sale.

"This is one of Europe's best-equipped foundries for small to medium-sized jobbing batches -- a profitable niche market largely closed to bigger foundries in view of the high flexibility required," Sulzer said.
It said Sulzer Buelachguss AG would be renamed Buelachguss AG and would continue independent operations with a healthy capital structure.
Sulzer last week said it would spin off ELMA Electronic AG and list its shares on the Swiss bourse in December as part of a strategy of shedding sideline businesses.

Its core divisions are Sulzermedica prosthetics and medical equipment, Sulzer Roteq pumps and compressors, Sulzer Infra plant and building services, Sulzer Winterthur engineering and Sulzer Rueti weaving machinery.
